Anthracnose.info: Fungal disease causing dark spots on leaves, stems, and fruit. Common in humid conditions.
Anthracnose.recommendations: Apply copper-based fungicides regularly, prune infected branches, improve air circulation.

Bacterial_Canker.info: Bacterial disease causing necrotic lesions and cankers on stems and leaves.
Bacterial_Canker.recommendations: Remove infected branches, sterilize pruning tools, apply copper bactericide.

Cutting_Weevil.info: Pest that causes V-shaped cuts on leaf margins.
Cutting_Weevil.recommendations: Use insecticidal sprays, remove heavily infested leaves, maintain plant vigor.

Die_Back.info: Disease causing branch dieback, often due to environmental stress or fungal infection.
Die_Back.recommendations: Prune dead branches, improve drainage, apply fungicides if fungal.

Gall_Midge.info: Insect pest causing gall formations on leaves and panicles.
Gall_Midge.recommendations: Remove infested plant parts, apply systemic insecticides during flowering.

Leaf_Spot.info: Various fungal pathogens causing brown or black spots on leaves.
Leaf_Spot.recommendations: Remove affected leaves, apply fungicides, improve air circulation.

Powdery_Mildew.info: Fungal disease causing white powdery coating on leaves and stems.
Powdery_Mildew.recommendations: Apply sulfur-based fungicides, increase light exposure, reduce humidity.

Sooty_Mould.info: Fungal disease appearing as black soot-like coating on leaves.
Sooty_Mould.recommendations: Control honeydew-producing insects, apply fungicides, improve ventilation.
